tit.e: Tsukasa (rank of government offices under ritsuryo system)
Ryo (a rank in government offices under ritsuryo system)
tit.cmt: 寮の読みとしてRyoを採用（Tsukasaでは司と混同してしまうため）。以下同様です。
tit.e: Ryo (a rank in government offices under ritsuryo system)

sen.j: 寮（つかさ・りょう）は日本古代の律令制における官司の等級の一つである。
sen.e: Tsukasa (also known as Ryo) was a rank of government offices under the ancient Japanese ritsuryo legal code system.
Ryo was a rank in government offices under the ancient Japanese ritsuryo legal code system.
sen.cmt: Tsukasa (also known as Ryo) was a rank of government offices --> Ryo was a rank in government offices
sen.e: Ryo was a rank in government offices under the ancient Japanese ritsuryo legal code system.

sen.j: 寮は職_(律令制)や司と共に主に省（中務省・式部省・治部省・民部省・宮内省の各省）のもとで事務を行った。
sen.e: Tsukasa took charge of clerical work with Shiki (ritsuryo system) mainly under the ministries (Nakatsukasasho, Shikibusho, Jibusho, Minbusho, and Kunaisho.)
Ryo took charge of clerical work together with Shiki (ritsuryo system) and Tsukasa mainly under the ministries (Nakatsukasasho, Shikibusho, Jibusho, Minbusho, and Kunaisho).
sen.cmt: 訳漏れがあります。「司と共に」の訳(= and Tsukasa)を追加。ピリオドを括弧の外に移動。
sen.e: Ryo took charge of clerical work together with Shiki (ritsuryo system) and Tsukasa mainly under the ministries (Nakatsukasasho, Shikibusho, Jibusho, Minbusho, and Kunaisho).

sen.j: 基本職員である四等官はそれぞれ頭（長官）－助（次官）－充（判官）－属（主典）とあらわす。
sen.e: Shitokan, the regular officials, were Kami - Suke - Jo - Sakan.
Shitokan, the regular officials, were described as Kami, Suke, Jo, and Sakan, respectively.
Shitokan, the regular officials, were described as Kami, Suke, Jo, and Sakan, respectively.

sen.j: 重要な部署が多く､廃止されたのはわずかに一つ（散位寮）しかない。
sen.e: Tsukasa had a lot of important branches so that only one branch, Sanniryo, was abolished.
Ryo had a lot of important branches, and only one branch, Sanniryo, was abolished.
Ryo had a lot of important branches, and only one branch, Sanniryo, was abolished.

sen.j: 馬寮や兵庫寮のように独立した寮もある。
sen.e: Some Tsukasa like Meryo and Hyogoryo became independent.
Some Tsukasa like Meryo and Hyogoryo became independent.
Some Tsukasa like Meryo and Hyogoryo became independent.

sen.j: 左・右兵庫は普通､寮を語尾につけない。
sen.e: Sahyogo and Uhyogo usually do not have the suffix 'ryo.'
Sahyogo and Uhyogo usually do not have the suffix 'ryo.'
Sahyogo and Uhyogo usually do not have the suffix 'ryo.'

sen.j: 職員数や官位によってさらに二等級に分類できる。
sen.e: Tsukasa can be classified into two ranks according to the number of officials and their court ranks.
Ryo can be classified further into two ranks according to the number of officials and their court ranks.
sen.cmt: Tsukasa can be classified into --> Ryo can be classified further into
sen.e: Ryo can be classified further into two ranks according to the number of officials and their court ranks.

sen.j: 大寮四等官の構成は頭（従五位上）-助（正六位下）-大允（正七位下）-少允（従七位上）-大属（従八位上）-少属（従八位下）
sen.e: Shitokan of Otsukasa were Kami (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade) - Suke (Senior Sixth Rank, Lower Grade) - Taijo (Senior Seventh Rank, Lower Grade) - Shojo (Junior Seventh Rank, Upper Grade) - Daisakan (Junior Eighth Rank, Upper Grade) - Shosakan (Junior Eighth Rank, Lower Grade.)

Shitokan of Oryo included Kami (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade) - Suke (Senior Sixth Rank, Lower Grade) - Taijo (Senior Seventh Rank, Lower Grade) - Shojo (Junior Seventh Rank, Upper Grade) - Daisakan (Junior Eighth Rank, Upper Grade) - Shosakan (Junior Eighth Rank, Lower Grade).
sen.cmt: Shitokan of Otsukasa were --> Shitokan of Oryo included
sen.e: Shitokan of Oryo included Kami (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade) - Suke (Senior Sixth Rank, Lower Grade) - Taijo (Senior Seventh Rank, Lower Grade) - Shojo (Junior Seventh Rank, Upper Grade) - Daisakan (Junior Eighth Rank, Upper Grade) - Shosakan (Junior Eighth Rank, Lower Grade).

sen.cmt: 「兵庫寮（独立）」はウェブでリンクになっているため「左・右兵庫」の誤りと思われますので、訂正して訳しました。

sen.j: 小寮四等官の構成は頭（従五位下）-助（従六位上）-允（従七位上）-大属（従八位下）-少属（大初位上）
sen.e: Shitokan of Shotsukasa were Kami (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) - Suke (Junior Sixth Rank, Upper Grade) - Jo (Junior Seventh Rank, Upper Grade) - Daisakan (Junior Eighth Rank, Lower Grade) - Shosakan (Greater Initial Rank, Upper Grade.)

Shitokan of Shoryo included Kami (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) - Suke (Junior Sixth Rank, Upper Grade) - Jo (Junior Seventh Rank, Upper Grade) - Daisakan (Junior Eighth Rank, Lower Grade) - Shosakan (Greater Initial Rank, Upper Grade).
sen.cmt: Shitokan of Shotsukasa were --> Shitokan of Shoryo included
sen.e: Shitokan of Shoryo included Kami (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) - Suke (Junior Sixth Rank, Upper Grade) - Jo (Junior Seventh Rank, Upper Grade) - Daisakan (Junior Eighth Rank, Lower Grade) - Shosakan (Greater Initial Rank, Upper Grade).
